Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., President of the Board ofTrade.Secretary.Sir Edward Bridges.Essential Work The War Cabinet were informed that in the negotiations with(General Pro- representatives of mine-owners and miners on the Essential Workvisions) Order. (General Provisions) Order, certain difficulties had arisen and someMiners' Wage far-reaching wage questions had been raised. General discussionQuestions. took place.The War Cabinet-Agreed that it was of the utmost importance to maintainthe " stabilisation policy," and approved the course whichthe President of the Board of Trade was taking in his negotiations with mine-owners' and miners' representa-tives.Great George Street, S.W. 1,May 1, 1941.[22477-2]
